repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Support to Philippines Basic
            Education Reforms Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Support to Philippines
            Basic Education Reforms Project for Philippines were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Grantee performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the
            institutionalization of reforms requires a long-term
            commitment on the part of government and the donor community
            to support the reform agenda. School based management (SBM)
            is an important tool for decentralizing an education system
            and improving learning outcomes. Public private partnerships
            are important for ensuring the long-term availability of
            adequate resources to support community schools. Solid
            analytical studies on system reforms during the
            implementation period are essential for making appropriate
            decisions on the elimination of bottlenecks to the reform
            agenda. Strong financial management systems are critical for
            ensuring the efficient use and accounting of resources.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Support for Philippines Basic
            Education Reforms Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Support
            for Philippines Basic Education Reforms Project is to
            support the implementation of the Philippine
            Government's Basic Education Sector Reform Agenda
            (BESRA) which in turn aims to contribute to the achievement
            of the Philippines' basic education goal of improving
            quality and equity in learning outcomes. The restructure
            will bring the following changes: a) closing date to be
            extended to November 30, 2013; b) activities to be
            implemented during the extension period include the
            construction of classrooms and Learning Resource and
            Management Development Centers (LRMDCs), and the procurement
            of school furniture and Information and Communication
            Technology (ICT) equipment.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - Support for
            Philippines Basic Education Reforms Project : restructuring
            : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Support to Basic Education
            Reforms Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Support
            to Basic Education Reforms Project is to support the
            implementation of the Philippine government's Basic
            Education Sector Reform Agenda (BESRA) which in turn aims to
            contribute to the achievement of the Philippines' basic
            education goal of improving quality and equity in learning
            outcomes. The project was originally approved on June 2,
            2008 for a total grant amount of US$32 million from the
            Australian Agency for International Aid (AusAID). In view of
            implementation delays encountered by the project, the
            changes include: (a) reallocation of grant proceeds across
            expenditure categories; (b) extension of closing date from
            December 31, 2012 to May 31, 2013; and (c) adjustment of the
            results framework targets to reflect the extension period
            and align these with the current targets in the Philippine
            Development Plan 2011-2016. This will be the second
            extension of the project. The first extension was for 18
            months, from July 1, 2011 to December 31, 2012.

Philippines - Support to Basic
            Education Reforms Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Support for Philippines Basic
            Education Reforms Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Support
            for Philippines Basic Education Reforms Project is to
            support the implementation of the Philippine
            government's Basic Education Sector Reform Agenda
            (BESRA) which in turn aims to contribute to the achievement
            of the Philippines' basic education goal of improving
            quality and equity in learning outcomes. The changes to the
            project include: a) extension of closing date to December
            31, 2012; and b) reallocation of grant proceeds among
            expenditure categories. The reallocation is intended to
            build more classrooms in areas with acute shortage; procure
            more technical assistance on critical areas of the reform
            program; conduct trainings and/or capacity building
            activities for regional, division and school-level
            personnel; provide more school-based management grants and
            provide for more incremental operating cost for travel,
            project monitoring and meetings and other operating costs
            incurred by the staff in the course of implementing the
            project activities.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - Support for
            Philippines Basic Education Reforms Project : restructuring
            : Main report
